org.research_software.citation.cff.model.objects

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.research_software.citation.cff.model.objects.Subject
      • org.research_software.citation.cff.model.objects.Entity

  • public final class Entity
extends Subject
    Model element representing an entity, e.g., a project group, organization, publishing house, conference, or similar.
    Version:
    Citation File Format Version 1.0.3
    Author:
    Stephan Druskat <[mail@sdruskat.net](mailto:mail@sdruskat.net)>
    See Also:
    https://citation-file-format.github.io/1.0.3/specifications/#/entity-objects

      Constructor for databinding.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity(String name,
              String dateStart,
              String dateEnd,
              String location,
              String address,
              String city,
              String region,
              String postCode,
              String country,
              String orcid,
              String email,
              String tel,
              String fax,
              String website)
       throws InvalidDataException
        Constructor for databinding.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the entity
        name - The name of the entity (**required**)
        dateEnd - The end date, if the entity is an event, e.g., a conference
        dateStart - The start date, if the entity is an event, e.g., a conference
        address - The address of the entity
        city - The city where the entity is located
        region - The region where the entity is located
        postCode - The post code ("zip code") of the city where the entity is located
        country - The country where the entity is located
        orcid - The ORCID iD of the entity
        email - The email address of the entity
        tel - The telephone number of the entity
        fax - The telefax number of the entity
        website - The website of the entity
        Throws:
        InvalidDataException - on invalid data and resulting parse errors, e.g., for date/time parses
